subject: Re: Books on Junit 4+
msgSnippet: Hi Lasse Koskela, I appreciate for such a quick response. I have been through a document. this is really very helpful in implementing testcases in junit. I
messageBody:
Hi Lasse Koskela,

I appreciate for such a quick response.
I have been through a document. this is really very helpful in
implementing testcases in junit.
I need something more than this, if you can do me a favor for this also.
things like:
- Junit with Ant,
- architectural perspective of junit,
- junit with eclipse etc.

Thanks
Amit Goyal
meet_goyal@...

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Lasse Koskela" <lasse.koskela@...> wrote:
>
> Hi Amit,
>
> On 4/23/07, meet_goyal <meet_goyal@...> wrote:
> > I have started junit4.3 for API testing and want to know some good
> > bookson Junit 4.+ explaining the arcitechture of Junit, use of Junit
> > and using Junit through Ant. Please suggest me as I am a beginer in
> > this field.
>
> I am not aware of any books describing JUnit 4 in more detail than a
> cursory overview (like the one I give in my upcoming book on TDD). The
> good news is that you don't need a book to learn JUnit 4 to get
> started--a good tutorial like this one by Gunjan Doshi is enough:
>
>
http://www.instrumentalservices.com/media/articles/java/junit4/JUnit4.pdf
>
> best regards,
> Lasse
>
